channel.title: SevenAtSevenSection1
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenSection1, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: She lost her purse — but strangers stepped in to save the day
item.description: On a trip to Chicago, Lavonne Schaafsma lost her purse. Two women saw a man rifling through it — and stepped in to help.

item.title: Disaster and insurance costs are rising. The middle class is struggling to hang on
item.description: Middle-class families are struggling to afford insurance in southwest Florida. Realtors say a wave of foreclosures could be coming.

item.title: More women are renting dresses, coats and ugly sweaters as clothing prices tick up
item.description: More women are planning to deck the halls in rented fashion this year, just as inflation and tariffs are poised to push clothing prices higher.

item.title: Alaska owns dozens of crumbling schools. It wants underfunded districts to take them on

item.title: With 'Baby Botox,' young adults strive to keep wrinkles from ever forming
item.description: A growing number of 20-somethings are trying to freeze time with preventative Botox treatments. Here's what's behind the trend.

item.title: Danish startup FlatPay joins the club of European fintech unicorns to track
item.description: Flatpay’s bet is that it can challenge larger players by charging small merchants a flat transaction rate to use its card terminals and point-of-sales...

item.title: Dozens arrested in North Carolina immigration enforcement surge, Border Patrol official says
‘Buy Now, Pay Later’ is expanding fast, and that should worry everyone
item.description: As Morris watches his BNPL investments from the other side of the table, he seems to understand the warning signs better than most.

item.title: Immigrant student enrollment is dwindling at schools across the US
Are we nearing the end of Apple’s Tim Cook era?
item.description: Apple is getting serious about succession planning, according to a new report.

item.title: Beloved SF cat’s death fuels Waymo criticism
item.description: The death of a neighborhood bodega cat named Kit Kat has shaken San Francisco’s Mission District and prompted new debates about robotaxi safety.

item.title: Amazon satellite network gets a rebrand — and drops its affordability pitch
item.description: The company has been quietly changing how it talks about who its internet customers will be before it announced a big name change last week.
